alternative_parents.description: Compounds consisting of an amine with a beta-N-glycosidic bond to a carbohydrate, thus forming a cyclic hemiaminal ether bond (alpha-amino ether).
alternative_parents.name: Glycosylamines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds that contain a pyrimidine ring, which bears a ketone. Pyrimidine is a 6-membered ring consisting of four carbon atoms and two nitrogen centers at the 1- and 3- ring positions.
alternative_parents.name: Pyrimidones

alternative_parents.description: Aromatic compounds containing a halogen atom linked to a pyrimidine ring. Pyrimidine is a 6-membered ring consisting of four carbon atoms and two nitrogen centers at the 1- and 3- ring positions.
alternative_parents.name: Halopyrimidines

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the acyl fluoride functional group.
alternative_parents.name: Aryl fluorides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a hydrogenated pyrimidine ring (i.e. containing less than the maximum number of double bonds.).
alternative_parents.name: Hydropyrimidines

alternative_parents.description: Heterocyclic compounds containing a saturated, aliphatic, five-membered ring where a carbon is replaced by an oxygen.
alternative_parents.name: Tetrahydrofurans

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an aromatic ring where a carbon atom is linked to an hetero atom.
alternative_parents.name: Heteroaromatic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a secondary alcohol functional group, with the general structure HOC(R)(R') (R,R'=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Secondary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Polyols containing an alcohol group at two adjacent positions.
alternative_parents.name: 1,2-diols

alternative_parents.description: Organic 1,3-dipolar compounds with the general structure  X#N+-Z- <-> X-=N+=Z <-> X-=N-Z+ <-> X-N=Z (X = C or O, Z = C, N, or O).
alternative_parents.name: Propargyl-type 1,3-dipolar organic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one oxygen atom linked to a ring carbon.
alternative_parents.name: Oxacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one nitrogen atom and one carbon atom linked to each other.
alternative_parents.name: Azacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a carboximidic group, with the general formula R-C(=NR1)OR2.
alternative_parents.name: Carboximidic acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a nitrogen atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organonitrogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a fluorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organofluorides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

class.description: Nucleosides in which the oxygen atom at the 5'position of the ribose moiety has been replaced by another atom. The nucleobases here are limited to purine, pyrimidine, and pyridine derivatives.
class.name: 5'-deoxyribonucleosides

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as 5'-deoxyribonucleosides. These are nucleosides in which the oxygen atom at the 5'position of the ribose moiety has been replaced by another atom. The nucleobases here are limited to purine, pyrimidine, and pyridine derivatives.

direct_parent.description: Nucleosides in which the oxygen atom at the 5'position of the ribose moiety has been replaced by another atom. The nucleobases here are limited to purine, pyrimidine, and pyridine derivatives.
direct_parent.name: 5'-deoxyribonucleosides

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

superclass.description: Compounds containing a nucleobase linked to a ribose or deoxyribose sugar via a beta-glycosidic linkage. The ribose or deoxyribose moiety bears at least a phosphate group in case of nucleotides.
superclass.name: Nucleosides, nucleotides, and analogues
